events.30\tOctober\t1883: Swami Dayanand Saraswati, founder of Arya Samaj, died in Ajmer.
events.30\tOctober\t1887: Sukumar Roy, famous Bengali children's litterateur, was born.
events.30\tOctober\t1889: Acharya Narendra Deo, educationist, freedom fighter and politician, was born at Sitapur, U.P.
events.30\tOctober\t1908: Pasumpon Muthuramalingam Thevar, freedom fighter and social worker, was born at Pasumpon village, Tamil Nadu.
events.30\tOctober\t1909: Homi Jahangir Bhabha, famous nuclear scientist, was born in Bombay.
events.30\tOctober\t1928: Madhav Vinayak Gothoskar, cricket Test umpire for 14 tests from 1972-84, was born in Mumbai.
events.30\tOctober\t1933: Dara Nadirsha Dotiwala, cricket Test umpire for 6 tests from 1981-88, was born in Mumbai.
events.30\tOctober\t1947: The first Spitfires from the Advanced Flying School at Ambala reached Srinagar and were soon engaged in strafing the raiders beyond Pattan. Within a week, the Tempests of No. 7 Squadron were playing a decisive role in the battle of Shelatang which halted the forward momentum of the insurgents.
events.30\tOctober\t1949: Pramond Venkatesh Devidas Mahajan was born in Mahaboobnagar (Andhra Pradesh).
events.30\tOctober\t1963: Pasumpon Muthuramalingam Thevar, nationalist, freedom fighter and social worker, died at Madurai.
events.30\tOctober\t1966: First meeting of the Shiv Sena at Shivaji Park.
events.30\tOctober\t1976: Elections to the lower house of the Indian Parliament suspended again until early 1978.
events.30\tOctober\t1977: One hundred thousand Tamil Hindu tea-pickers, who were expatriated from Sri Lanka, are shipped to Madras, South India.
events.30\tOctober\t1990: Several people died and many injured as security forces opened fire at a crowd marching towards Ram Janmabhumi/Babari Masjid to perform 'karseva'.
events.30\tOctober\t1991: Norberto Carvalho, vetern freedom fighter of Goa freedom fight, passed away.
events.30\tOctober\t1992: India and China decide to continue peace measures and open more points for border trade.
events.30\tOctober\t1994: India seeks Chinese support for Security Council membership.
events.30\tOctober\t1996: Pop star Michael Jackson arrives in Bombay.
events.30\tOctober\t1997: Kerala Kaumudi's Kannur edition and Internet edition begin.
events.30\tOctober\t1999: The Central Ministerial team led by Mr. Advani is prevented from making an on-the-spot assessment of the havoc wrecked by the super cyclone.
events.30\tOctober\t2000: The 160-page CBI's report on cricket match-fixing names Azharuddin, Ajay Jadeja, Ajay Sharma, Manoj Prabhakar and former physiotherapist Dr. Ali Irani for their deep-rooted nexus with betting syndicates. It virtually gives a clean chit to Kapil Dev.
